title: Ancient Wonders of China
text:
14, 2015 
Take a trip to Beijing, Guangzhou, Hong Kong or any other Chinese city with our best airfare deals. Hike on the Great Wall of China, Cuddle a Giant Panda, Embark on a Yangtze River Cruise, and take a ride on the Chinese high-speed rail and enjoy the scenic beauty of this amazing destination. 
China, the most populated country of the world is a nation in the East Asia which is famous for its grasslands, deserts, mountains, lakes, rivers and coastline that can make you wonder in surprise. It is a home to many skyscrapers, historic sites and architectures that are hard to find anywhere else in the world. From natural beauty to food and culture, everything is simply outstanding. But if you think that China is famous for technology, culture and food only, then take a look at the top places that shall be visited on your next visit to this astonishing land. 
Great Wall of China: Known to be the greatest and the only man-made structure that can be seen from the moon, the Great Wall of China is one of the most popular attractions of the China. This 6,000 km long wall is renowned in the whole world and has been on the list of many travelers since ages. This ancient structure has an array of stunning sights that makes your trip worthwhile. Qin Shi Huang’s Mausoleum: Located in the Lintong District, Xi'an, Shaanxi province of China, this mausoleum was built by the Chinese Emperor, Qin Shi Huang. It is an archaeological site which is situated beneath a 76-meter tall tomb mound. The architecture and the path of this mausoleum is itself an experience that gives you the feeling of going on a treasure hunt. Make sure you visit it on your trip to China. The Forbidden City: It is a Chinese Imperial Palace in Beijing which happens to be one of the most popular landmarks of the country. Once the home of the emperors, the palace has now become a Palace Museum which has been declared as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This structure is the size of 80 football fields and has amazing spots that will leave spell bound. Don’t forget to explore the impeccable charm of this ancient palace. The Hangzhou–Beijing Canal: This 1200 miles long canal is yet another pick from the Chinese nation that has made in the history because of being called the longest artificial river in the world. It is an important waterway that was once a major source of importing goods and people from Hangzhou to Beijing. It is also a world cultural heritage site of China that has been made by human beings. 
China has a rich historical past with ancient heritage that makes a special place in the world’s history. More places can be explored while being here, so book a cheap flight to China and discover the charisma of this wonderland.   from ArticlesFactory.com ABOUT THE AUTHOR
